definition: sheng, a free reed wind instrument with vertical bamboo pipes

to take care (of)/to control/to manage/to be in charge of/to look after/to run/to care about/tube/pipe/woodwind/classifier for tube-shaped objects/particle similar to 把[ba3] in 管...叫 constructions/writing brush/(coll.) to/towards
suona, Chinese shawm/see 嗩吶|唢呐
huqin/family of Chinese two-stringed fiddles, with snakeskin covered wooden soundbox and bamboo bow with horsehair bowstring
suona, Chinese shawm (oboe), used in festivals and processions or for military purposes/also written 鎖吶|锁呐/also called 喇叭[la3 ba5]
reed-pipe wind instrument with a keyboard
xiao, a Chinese musical instrument of ancient times, similar to panpipes
to perform music/to play a tune
